ch.dermitza.securenio

Class TCPServer

  • java.lang.Object
    • ch.dermitza.securenio.AbstractSelector
      • ch.dermitza.securenio.TCPServer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    HandshakeListener, TaskListener, TimeoutListener, java.lang.Runnable

    public class TCPServer
extends AbstractSelector
    A TCP Server implementation of AbstractSelector. This implementation is purely non-blocking and can handle both PlainSockets and SecureSockets.

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class ch.dermitza.securenio.AbstractSelector

        address, cipherSuits, container, context, isClient, logger, needClientAuth, pendingData, port, protocols, selector, singleThreaded, taskWorker, toWorker, usingSSL

      Constructors

      Create a TCPServer instance.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      protected void accept(java.nio.channels.SelectionKey key)
      Accepts incoming connections and binds new non-blocking SocketIF instances to them.
      protected void connect(java.nio.channels.SelectionKey key)
      As this is the server implementation, it is NOT allowed to call this method which is only useful for client implementations.
      protected void initConnection()
      Initialize a server connection.
      void send(SocketIF sc, PacketIF packet)
      Send an PacketIF over the specified SocketIF.

    • Constructor Detail

      • TCPServer

        public TCPServer(java.net.InetAddress address,
         int port,
         AbstractPacketWorker packetWorker,
         boolean usingSSL,
         boolean singleThreaded,
         boolean needClientAuth)
        Create a TCPServer instance.
        Parameters:
        address - The address to bind to
        port - The port to listen on
        packetWorker - The instance of packet worker to use
        usingSSL - Whether we are using SSL/TLS
        singleThreaded - Whether or not the SSLEngine tasks should run on the same thread or on the TaskWorker thread.
        needClientAuth - Whether we need clients to also authenticate

    • Method Detail

      • send

        public void send(SocketIF sc,
        PacketIF packet)
        Send an PacketIF over the specified SocketIF.
        Parameters:
        sc - The SocketIF to send the packet through.
        packet - The PacketIF to send through the associated SocketIF.
        See Also:
        AbstractSelector.send(ch.dermitza.securenio.socket.SocketIF, java.nio.ByteBuffer)

      • initConnection

        protected void initConnection()
                       throws java.io.IOException
        Initialize a server connection. This method initializes a ServerSocketChannel, configures it to non-blocking, binds it to the specified (if any) host and port, sets the specified backlog and registers it with the underlying Selector instance with an OP_ACCEPT SelectionKey.
        Specified by:
        initConnection in class AbstractSelector
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Propagates all underlying IOExceptions as thrown, to be handled by the application layer.
        See Also:
        AbstractSelector.run()

      • accept

        protected void accept(java.nio.channels.SelectionKey key)
        Accepts incoming connections and binds new non-blocking SocketIF instances to them. If this server implementation is using SSL/TLS, it also sets up the SSLEngine, to be used.
        Specified by:
        accept in class AbstractSelector
        Parameters:
        key - The selection key with the underlying SocketChannel to be accepted
        See Also:
        AbstractSelector.run()

      • connect

        protected void connect(java.nio.channels.SelectionKey key)
        As this is the server implementation, it is NOT allowed to call this method which is only useful for client implementations. This implementation will throw a NoSuchMethodError if it is called and do nothing else.
        Specified by:
        connect in class AbstractSelector
        Parameters:
        key - The selection key to be used for connecting.
        See Also:
        AbstractSelector.run()
